Articles.Content:
What will you do? Vote on the Poll!

I'll spaz with the now part on Every planet and try to find the hidden upgrade.

I wanna see what the KSP Community will do
Probably delete the new parts since they take up a lot of memory
Pretty much same old story, since I'm playing vanilla stock. So, get contract, sciences unlock parts. Whenever all part are unlock, I will stop playing and wait for next update.
Start a new career save and check out the new features while waiting for the realism mods to update so I can fix the bugs in the game. Basically the same thing I've done for the last two updates.
start a new carrer
Probably stat over again... for the 7th time...

Mostly watching the forums. In the few free evenings I get between then and 0.26 I'll try once again to unlock enough parts to get nicely to the MÃƒÂ¼n & Minmus before next release come along... like I do with every release.
I'll be doing what I do with every new release of KSP that adds to Career mode: explore the potential of the new additions and find new ways to min/max my way to success.

I'll probably play through career mode for about an hour or 2 before I get bored, then wait patiently for (imo) necessary mods to be updated. I might even start working on my own mod idea I've had brewing in the back of my mind, while I wait for those mods.

Apart from a few hours in .24 I am still finishing (or not rather) my .23.2 save ... Having maneuvered myself into an uncomfortable situation, but at the same time unwilling to leave my missions unfinished ... I really should get going, will be a good character building exercise.

So, I most likely will wait for my critical mods to get updated and start a new career.
The same as after each update: restart career mode, gather science, blow stuff up, have fun

The same as after each update: restart career mode, gather science, blow stuff up, have fun

This is my life story...

1. Install the new version.

2. Mess around for a short time to take a peak at the new features.

3. Wait for 1st bug stomping hotfix.

4. Wait for mods to get updated.

5. Start a new save.
Having seen the recent screengrabs, I believe I will be crashing things a lot.
New Entry: Searching for new Eastereggs #savethemagicboulder !!!!

"They see me Fly'in, they hate' in"

I hope the integrated SP+ parts will finally be able to be attached to radial decouplers. I has plans.
i'll start building space planes again and updating older designs. I cant wait for the new parts!

The first thing?

Well, build something with the new parts and crash it anywhere just to see the new explosions.

Then, I will use the Secret Feature(depending on what is that feature, my first move could be to use it)
Bomb bays. Lots and lots of bomb bays.
Start over, play through I guess
Finding the seeekret feature!

Pretty much same old story, since I'm playing vanilla stock. So, get contract, sciences unlock parts. Whenever all part are unlock, I will stop playing and wait for next update.

What a boring way to play the game.

Voted Spaz with the new parts

Strategize! Which is not a voting option. New parts are all well and good, but I cannot wait to get my hands on all of the pro-science strategies. At least until tier 4 unlocks. Then it's money-making time!

When 0.25 is released, the first thing I will do is stare at the clock until it is time to leave work. Then I will go home, download it, and install it.

Then I will make a list of the mods I have installed, and the current version. I will start looking at those mods to see which ones work and which ones don't. I will wait for them to be updated, or wait long enough to give up on them. I will try out a few new mods, and maybe consider adding them to my mix. Once things are stable, I will start a new save file.

Then I will build things, and then launch them. I will repeat this cycle until the next version arrives or I get bored.

Edited September 23, 2014 by razark

Probably I will make first a short test what new things are implemented in the game. Then I will wait several weeks before all mods I want to use will be updated. Then I will decide if I try to continue my game on new version. It depends on how old save works and what new things are in the game. If there is not more than already published cosmetic improvements and career game modifications, I will probably not change if it is not just load old game into new version and continue. I have just went through part opening phase and now I want to make more interesting things than boring hopping all around Mun and Minmus to gather science points to get parts to do something funny. For me the "funny" is mostly planetary bases and stations in Jool system, Eve-trip etc.

At some day I want to try planes. I installed FAR already, but uninstalled it because it disabled the possibility to launch huge and odd shaped payloads to orbit. I do not want to use an hour or two to assembling every ship on Kerbin orbit before leaving to their targets. It will probably be a different save with different mods. Maybe 0.25's new plane parts give a necessary kick to me to start.
